JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Blue Power Partners is a global consultancy and project development company with a dedicated focus on developing renewable energy. We are expanding our activities and currently looking for a finance trainee to strengthen our Finance & Controlling team.

The Finance & Controlling team provides Blue Power Partners with finance data that shows transparency and provides an overview of the “Financial status” of each department, unit and project. The team provides service to the subsidiaries as well as the parent company. The group consists right now of six companies. 

The team consists of one manager, one financial controller and two accountants who work closely together to share knowledge, support, and optimize within their area of expertise. Besides being a part of a competent and cooperating team, you can also expect to be a part of a very positive and social environment. 

The finance trainee will be simultaneously aligned with Aalborg Business School, where a distinction is made between theory and practice. Starting date is September 2022.

About the Job

  • Accounts receivable accounting including invoicing, bookkeeping, reconciliation and recovery of arrears and dispatch of reminders and maintenance of master data 
  • Accounts payable including payments by creditors, reconciliation and maintenance of master data 
  • Financial accounting including bookkeeping, reconciliation of VAT, banking, etc. 
  • Handling of travel settlements and expenses 
  • Support on monthly reporting 
  • Salary including procedures and reconciliations, including maintenance of master data of employees

Our headquarters in Aalborg, John F. Kennedys Plads, will be your working place. 

About You 

To qualify as a financial trainee, it is important that you have finished one of the following programs: H2G (office/ administration), EUX (study qualifying courses), HHX, HTX, STX or HF with supplementary of 5 weeks EUS5 course from Business School. 

All applicants over 25 years of age and those that started their basic course after 1 August 2015 have to send the education plan, which can be requested by contacting the local Business School.

To be successful in this role you approach your tasks in a structured manner, you deliver on a high level of quality, and you work well with deadlines. You have a service-minded attitude and adapt easily to the changing needs in the company. You enjoy a positive environment and being a part of a team where we gladly offer our assistance when help is needed. 

We also expect you to enrich our business with the following experience: 

  • Confident with IT systems and Microsoft Office 
  • Good analytical skills, solution-driven mindset 
  • You can work independently and in teams
  • You have a flair for economics and numbers
  • Confident in English (oral and written)

Contact

 For additional information about this position, please contact Emilie Bundgaard Jensen, Financial Controller, ebj@bluepp.dk
